channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Brambles on Anderson Way along footpath from bus shelter, 13th June
item.description:
The brambles on Anderson Way along the footpath from the bus stop to the end of Anderson where it turns into Crabtree Manorway. They need cutting back immediately as wheelchair users are getting caught up in them on route to Bexley Wheelchair Unit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anderson Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse left outside on street, 13th June
item.description:
Bags of refuse covering pathway causing people to walk in road. Despite having a refuse collection tgis Friday morning it has been left uncollected and left to litter up the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish in the canal, 13th June
item.description:
I wish to bring to your attention the issue of rubbish and excessive algae in the local canal. The waste is harming the wildlife and plants, and is causing flies to breed, which then enter nearby homes. Could you please arrange for the canal to be cleaned and maintained? Prompt action would be greatly appreciated to protect the environment and local residents. Thank you for your attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter proble, 13th June
item.description:
The street cleaner walked along Broom Avenue and straight past Palewll Close again. The litter has not been collected for some time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London

item.description:
Please clear

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Queensway, Bayswater, London

item.title: Excessive E-bikes and Scooters, 13th June
item.description:
Outside 54a Ebury Street the e-bikes and scooters for hire have taken up 2 paid parking spaces due to the volume of bikes. There is a designated parking space for the bikes but as there are so many bikes the overflow into the parking spaces. Please could you address this with Lime and Forest Green bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80-100, Ebury Street, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of fly tipping, 13th June
item.description:
The car parking layby on Whitewebbs road is lttered with flytipping and general rubbish such as disgarded bedding, builders rubbish and fibreglass insulation. See attached photos, Also the pedestrian entrance to the woods has been obstructed by builders rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitewebbs Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burned motorbike near the footpath in Marvels Wood. Needless to say, the petrol will have soaked into the earth and could poison the trees around it. Please deal with it, thanks!, 13th June

item.title: Contractors strimmed a protected area, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Berens Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Lorry reversing into lamppost leaving it in wonky position, 13th June
item.description:
A CountryClean lorry reversed into the lamppost outside Marble House in W9 3PT leaving it in a leaning position. The incident happened this morning just before 10am. The lorry drove off in direction of Harrow Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Elgin Avenue, Maida Hill, London
